Package Controllers

Class AddAppointmentsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controllers.AddAppointmentsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddAppointmentsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class controls the Add Appointment view. There is a save and return to home screen buttons actions. Also, there are some on click functions to help filter combo box list data

      This action event attempts to save the input information to the database as a new appointment.The if statements checks the input is empty and flips a boolean to false.

      void onClickRemoveHour​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      When the user clicks on the start hour combo box; without having to select any items from the combo box, it will filter out the 11pm hour.This lambda is used to help confine the user to putting items in with inside business hours.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This void method helps set all the label text on initialization. The label text is pulled from the language resource bundle. Also, it fills certain combo boxes
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        rb -

      • onActionSaveAppointment

        public void onActionSaveAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This action event attempts to save the input information to the database as a new appointment.The if statements checks the input is empty and flips a boolean to false. The local date time is made from a combination of a date picker and combo boxes with military time. Before being written to the database, it performs a check for overlapping appointments for a particular customer. So different customers may have overlapping timed appointments.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -

      • onActionGoHome

        public void onActionGoHome​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This action event takes the user back to the home screen.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -

      • onActionSetHourToChangeMinutes

        public void onActionSetHourToChangeMinutes​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        When the user chooses an hour from the star hour combo box this method will set the start time minute combo box with the appropriate values
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -

      • onActionSetEndHourToChangeMinutes

        public void onActionSetEndHourToChangeMinutes​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        When the user chooses an hour from the end hour combo box this method will set the end time minute combo box with the appropriate values. This also ensures no appointments can be made after 11pm
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -

      • onClickRemoveHour

        public void onClickRemoveHour​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        When the user clicks on the start hour combo box; without having to select any items from the combo box, it will filter out the 11pm hour.This lambda is used to help confine the user to putting items in with inside business hours.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - This mouse event starts when the user clicks to bring up the combo box list items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionGetCustomerAppointmentList

        public void onActionGetCustomerAppointmentList​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This action event is after the user selects a customer from the combo box. After the selection is made, it passes it into the get customer appointment method which makes an SQL query to find all the associated appointments for the selected customer id.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
